* Extensive knowledge of the Nordic energy market and regulatory landscape.
* Strong analytical, financial, and strategic thinking skills.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in English and Swedish. Knowledge in Danish is a plus.


**📍 Location**
 We value office collaboration but support some hybride work. Our office is at Söder Mälarstrand, minutes away from Gamla Stan subway station in Stockholm.
   

  

**🛒 Apply**
 To apply, please submit your resume and answer the questions in the application. In the recruitment process you will meet with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, our Head of Asset Development Nordics, VP of Asset Development & Partnerships, and CEO.
   

  

 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office, so we want you to submit your CV in English.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Please note, we will start review candidates in September. Flower wish you a delightful summer! 🌸**

title: Fullstack Developer, Solna
description:
We seek to strengthen our position and increase the speed of exploration in PostNord Group IT. We are looking for a Fullstack Developer who will play an important role in our advancement of rapid prototyping capabilities. We offer you an open and inclusive work environment, with very competent colleagues as well as good benefits. Apply now to the Fullstack Developer role!
   

  

**Join us**
 The Technology Acceleration area within Group IT is responsible for exploring the future IT landscape and create prototypes and MVP’s that will be the foundation for PostNord's digital journey.
   

  

 As a Fullstack developer you will be a part of our newly founded concept development team. The concept development team will refine needs or hypotheses into a concrete concept and assess feasibility and market viability of the proposed concept before delivering a working prototype, proving or disproving a hypothesis.
   

  

**Job Duties**
* Work closely with other business stakeholders, designers, product owners, and other developers within PostNord to ensure concepts contribute to and draw from a holistic company perspective.
* Contribute to the product development in PostNord through the development of prototypes
* Partcipate and guide colleagues and stakeholders in interactive and creative problem-solving sessions.


**Your profile as a Fullstack Developer**
 You are curious and like to ask the question why – more than once – to understand the needs of your stakeholders rather than their more direct wishes. You like to work hands on and facilitate workshops and discussions, and to work directly with our business stakeholders.
   

  

 As a person you are eager to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state-of-the-art pace in the domain that you work in. The drive to do this comes from understanding the business and deliver the best possible value, where you see technology as the means and not the goal.
   

  

 In a setting where everything is new, you are comfortable discovering the way as you go without detailed instructions, but also in turning your explorative findings into structure and order that can be re-applied in similar situations in the future.
   

  

**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
* Academic education in computer science or equivalent experience.
* At least 5 years relevant working experience.
* Worked with agile working methods and according to DevOps principles.
* Extensive experience developing IT solutions, being part of design, architecture, requirements, development, testing, and deployment to production. Having done this in Azure environment is a plus.
* Experience in frontend development (React, Typescript and Next.js or similar) and backend development with .Net (preferred) or JAVA.
* You have worked in cross functional teams with agile working methods and according to DevOps principles.


**Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)**
* Familiarity with modern data platforms. ADF and Databricks is a plus. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps,
* Have used prototypes and MVP’s to iterate and enhance new solutions.
* Worked with data heavy solutions, or has worked in a data scientist role before.
* Basic data analysis- and data visualization skills in tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or D3.js.
* Basic understanding of ML and statistical models


**Language requirement:**
 Fluent English in speech and writing. Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.
   

  

**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer you a flexible hybrid workplace with a prestige-free environment where we as a team help each other to reach our goals. We encourage self-sufficient leadership for development and career opportunities. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Work in a Nordic/International and flexible environment.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions
* Wellness allowance & access to office gym and swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Christian Mejlvang, Christian.mejlvang@postnord.com
   

  

 Click here for union contact

title: C++ Developer - XRY Core Technology
description:
*The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. We are the global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis, with the sole focus of on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defense Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption. Our core values are to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results.*
**About The Role**
 The XRY Core Technology Team is responsible for managing all our data formats. Responsibilities include decoding a wide range of image, audio, video, text and filesystem data formats making them available for querying and analysis.
   

  

 As a member of the XRY Core Technology team you will be working on storage for various types of evidence data in a reliable and efficient manner. Day-to-day activities include implementing support for new features, dependency management, documentation, and assisting all product teams to leverage our core technology efficiently.
   

  

**Must have:**
* At minimum, 4 years of experience with C++ (writing, testing, debugging and profiling)
* Interest for data storage and ontology models including RDF
* Experience building distributed systems


**Nice to have:**
* Knowledgeable of compression algorithms for sound, video or similar
* Competence within CI/CD and specifically VCPKG
* Competence within .NET and C# development
* Competence within Python development
* Competence within CUDA programming
* Previous industry experience within digital forensics


**What We Can Offer...**
 Create a safer world with us!
   

  

 As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.
   

  

 Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You’ll be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you’ll deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.
   

  

 We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.
   

  

 Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.
   

  

**Are you up for the challenge?**
 Send in your application now!
   

  

 For more information about the role, please contact susanne.kjellman@msab.com.

title: Golang Developer
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **3+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

 Rollbeskrivning:
   

  

 We are looking for senior backend engineer with expertise in Go (preferably) and/or Java. We are a team of 7 engineers (mobile engineers, QA engineer, and backend engineers), plus a UX designer, a product owner, and an Engineering manager. We are the mobile team responsible for building the Storefront experience for mobile apps to serve our customers with the ability to buy digital and physical goods.
   

  

 Your daily tasks will include actively defining and working on the day-to-day development tasks and contributing to the team’s product vision through technical guidance. We’d like to expect that you have worked with various projects where you have assumed a lead role or taken responsibility for implementing a technical solution that is well-designed, tested, maintained, and monitored. We think you are an exceptional backend engineer who’s worked on various
   

  

 products in the past.
   

  

 You are passionate about knowledge sharing through documentation or demos/presentations and proactively seek opportunities to suggest/implement a more efficient and reliable technical solution based on data from monitoring our services and systems. It is essential that while doing this you also contribute to an inclusive environment where you are open to and even actively seek feedback from your team members/colleagues about your contributions, are open to their suggestions, and ultimately seek ways to create the most efficient and valuable outcomes. Similarly, giving reinforcement and constructive feedback to your colleagues is just as valuable and important. You will be supporting a group of mobile developers and collaborating with your backend engineer colleague. We imagine you as someone with a positive and supportive attitude who likes contributing to their growth and seeks opportunities to learn from them.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Expertise in Go and Java
* Experience in deploying in a dockers/Kubernetes/Azure setup. Our CI/CD is based on Github actions.
* You should have a solid understanding of microservices.
* You understand the importance of building and utilizing Application Performance Monitoring systems (here we use Elastic among others). It is valuable for us that you are passionate about advocating for measuring and tracking relevant metrics that drive user satisfaction and ensure business profitability (SLI/SLO metrics).
* You will be expected to know how to work with GraphQL since our backend is meant to talk to the Federated Graph providing services that our frontend clients consume. Finally, it will be a huge bonus if you are somewhat familiar with React.js and have some frontend know-how.


**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: ERP Developer (Acumatica)
description:
Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection — providing natively inte grated , all-in-one solution s that monitor, cont rol , and protec t the data that businesses and lives depend on . We are looking for an ERP Administrator to join our mission to create a # Cyber Fit future and protect all data, applications, and systems across any environment.
   

  

 The ERP Administrator who will be reporting directly under the VP of ERP will be responsible for managing the corporate Acumatica ERP system, supporting its users, taking ownership of our Acumatica helpdesk, and continually improving the ERP system. This role will also lead various customization, software development, and integration projects, designing, developing new, and maintaining existing Acumatica customizations.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Design and develop new Acumatica customizations and integrations tailored to meet the specific needs of our organization
* Troubleshoot and maintain existing customizations and integrations, ensuring their functionality and compatibility with system upgrades
* Successfully manage the company's Acumatica ERP system, ensuring its smooth operation and optimal performance
* Provide ongoing support to Acumatica ERP users, resolving issues, and addressing user concerns promptly
* Conduct regular maintenance tasks, including customization deployments, updates, upgrades, and performance optimizations
* Offer technical guidance to other team members and stakeholders on Acumatica-related matters


**What You Bring (experience & Qualifications)**
* 4+ years of experience managing ERP solutions, with a strong understanding of ERP systems and processes.
* 2+ years of hands-on experience with Acumatica support, or customization/programming, or functional/implementation consultant experience with Acumatica ERP.
* Proficiency in C# and .NET Framework
* Knowledge of T-SQL and experience working with Microsoft SQL relational databases.
* Solid understanding of accounting principles and practices.
* Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and collaboratively within a distributed team.
* Willingness to occasionally work on weekends for scheduled maintenance tasks.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Please submit your resume and application in English


**Who We Are**
 Acronis is a global cyber protection company that provides natively integrated cybersecurity, data protection, and endpoint management for managed service providers (MSPs), small and medium businesses (SMBs), enterprise IT departments and home users. Our all-in-one solutions are highly efficient and designed to identify, prevent, detect, respond, remediate, and recover from modern cyberthreats with minimal downtime, ensuring data integrity and business continuity. We offer the most comprehensive security solution on the market for MSPs with our unique ability to meet the needs of diverse and distributed IT environments.
   

  

 A Swiss company founded in Singapore in 2003, Acronis offers over twenty years of innovation with 15 offices worldwide and more than 1800 employees in 50+ countries. Acronis Cyber Protect is available in 26 languages in 150 countries and is used by over 20,000 service providers to protect over 750,000 businesses.
   

  

 Our corporate culture is focused on making a positive impact on the lives of each employee and the communities we serve. Mutual trust, respect and belief that we can contribute to the world everyday are the cornerstones of our team. Each member of our “A-Team” plays an instrumental role in driving the success of our innovative and expanding business. We seek individuals who excel in dynamic, global environments and have a never give up attitude, contributing to our collective growth and impact.
   

  

 Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

title: GoLang Developer
description:
**About The Company**
 A prominent software development firm specializes in creating innovative solutions for energy companies and startups with energy-related products. With a team of skilled software engineers and data scientists, the company focuses on product development, data engineering, and cloud infrastructure.
   

  

 Typical projects involve constructing robust data infrastructure utilizing tools such as Kubernetes, Airflow, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, InfluxDB, and Kafka. Machine learning components are developed using technologies like Spark and PyTorch, while APIs and software ensure seamless communication between services, employing languages like Python, FastAPI, Django, Kafka, and RabbitMQ. The company also builds user interfaces (UIs) that allow end-users to operate systems and visualize data and analyses, using tools such as React, ThreeJS, and WebGL. These UIs range from administrative panels and analytical dashboards to sophisticated 3D-based digital twins.
   

  

**About The Candidate**
 The ideal candidate is passionate about coding and technology, with a strong command of at least one back-end language, preferably Pytxhon, and a solid understanding of web front-end languages (HTML/CSS/JS/TS). The candidate is empathetic to customer needs, enjoys problem-solving, and is capable of making pragmatic decisions with clear reasoning. They work collaboratively with the team to address technical challenges, striking a balance between speed and the creation of scalable, maintainable solutions, and appreciate both abstract thinking and practical execution.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 The candidate will primarily focus on the back-end stack of projects, though support on both the front-end and back-end may be required depending on the project. Responsibilities include mentoring the team in development methodologies, planning and executing application development projects with precision and speed, conducting constructive code reviews, and leading development teams and initiatives.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience with a modern back-end stack, preferably Python
* Experience in front-end development
* Experience with deployments on AWS and/or Azure
* Ability to write high-quality, readable, understandable, and testable code
* Strong knowledge of Docker and Git
* Understanding of profiling and performance optimization
* Leadership experience and strong communication skills
* Experience managing state in front-end applications
* Ability to build responsive applications that handle large datasets
* Strong opinions on connecting applications with external APIs


**Bonus**
* Experience with tools such as Kubernetes, Spark, Airflow, Kafka, Timescale, PyTorch, or Keras.

title: Ledande GPU Software Engineer till Mycronic!
description:
Tänk dig de mest högteknologiska elektronikprodukterna du kan föreställa dig, och sen tänker du ett steg längre. Med världsledande produktionslösningar leder Mycronic elektronikindustrin och skapar nutidens mest högteknologiska produkter, men med en ödmjukhet inför att det viktigaste för att lyckas med detta är en passion för såväl affärer som teknik och framför allt människor. Mycronic befinner sig i en expansiv fas där de vill fortsätta etablera sig på fler marknader och i fler länder och för att göra detta söker de personer som vill vara med på deras fortsatta resa. Har du några års arbetslivserfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, vana av att arbeta hårdvarunära och vill vara med och tänja gränserna för vad GPU kan göra? Då har du kommit rätt!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Mycronic AB (publ)
 



  

**Plats :**
 Täby
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Mycronic är ett svenskt bolag som i över 40 år har utvecklat och tillverkat maskiner för elektronik- och displaytillverkning och de har idag kunder och distributörer i över 50 länder världen över. I dagsläget finns det inget annat företag i hela världen som kan konkurrera med Mycronics teknik och produkter. Alla skärmar med hög upplösning du ser, oavsett om det är TV, telefon, surfplatta, Apple Watch etc. så är de tillverkade med Mycronics maskiner och det är dessa som du kommer att vara en viktig del i utvecklingen av. Du kommer att befinna dig i den absoluta framkanten av elektronikindustrin och jobba i ett blandat team med både juniora och erfarna utvecklare inom såväl C++, Java och C. Utöver det samarbetar du i tvärdisciplinära projekt tillsammans med ingenjörer inom såväl elektronik, mekatronik, mekanik, optik och litografi och ni arbetar gemensamt för att ta fram de bästa lösningarna.
 


  


  

**Några ord från en av gruppcheferna inom mjukvara på Mycronic**



  


 “Hos oss kommer du möta utmaningar i den absoluta framkanten av dagens teknik inom området parallellbearbetning och GPU-accelererad beräkning. Mycronic har ett varmt, vänligt och innovativt företagsklimat med en inkluderande kultur och vi välkomnar gärna dig som vill vara en del av detta :)"
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En roll med stor frihet under ansvar och en möjlighet att verkligen göra skillnad med dina kunskaper inom utveckling och GPU.
  
* En möjlighet att arbeta med hela utvecklingskedjan från krav till koncept, utveckling och test.
  
* Hos Mycronic arbetar personer från olika delar av världen, i olika åldrar och med olika erfarenheter vilket är något som ses som en styrka. Här blir du en del av ett företag med en öppen företagskultur där man hjälper och tror på varandra och för Mycronic är mångfald inte bara en konkurrensfördel utan också en viktig pusselbit för en innovativ och givande arbetsmiljö.
  


  


  

**Bringing tomorrow's electronics to life.**



  

  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Divisionen PG (Pattern Generator) som du kommer att tillhöra har idag en mjukvaruorganisation om runt 60 medarbetare uppdelade på 7 team där du kommer att tillhöra ett av dem. Rollen som GPU Software Engineer är ny då GPU är ett relativt nytt område för Mycronic som man kommer att satsa mycket på framåt. Målet med detta är att kunna bearbeta data snabbare och på så sätt leverera ännu mer värde till deras kunder. Du kommer att vara en viktig del i arbetet med att maximera prestandan och säkerställa att ni får ut så mycket som möjligt av hårdvaran men också att göra produkten så användarvänlig som möjligt. Du kommer att jobba med hela utvecklingsprocessen från ax till limpa och samarbeta tätt med dina kollegor där dina idéer både kommer uppskattas och lyftas och tillsammans möjliggör ni morgondagens elektronikproduktion.
 


  


 Vidare kommer du att…
 


  

  
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att designa och implementera GPU
  
* Optimera befintlig programvara för GPU-arkitekturer för att maximera prestanda och effektivitet
  
* Göra research för att hitta nya tekniker inom GPU och hålla dig uppdaterad inom de senaste inom GPU-teknik och CUDA-programmering
  
* Genomföra kodgranskning, testning och felsökning
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och intresse för Mycronic som företag och denna specifika tjänst. Motivera väl i din ansökan varför du valt att söka.
 


  

  
* Har minst en kandidatexamen inom datateknik, elektronik eller liknande
  
* Flerårig erfarenhet inom området
  
* Har goda kunskaper inom CUDA-programmering och GPU-arkitektur
  
* Har förståelse för parallellprogrammering
  
* Har goda kunskaper inom C/C++
  


  


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har…
 


  

  
* Kunskaper inom OpenCL eller Vulkan
  
* Kunskaper inom TensorFlow eller PyTorch
  
* Kunskaper inom OpenGL, DirectX eller liknande
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Placering: Täby, möjlighet till ett par dagars distansarbete per vecka
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Johanna Sörell, Recruitment Consultant, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  
* Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Mycronics önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work.
  
* Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work + personlighetstest & problemlösningstest
  
* Intervjuer med Mycronic
  
* Referenstagning + beslut
  


  

  

  

  

  

**Mycronic AB (publ)**

 Läs mer om Mycronic på deras hemsida: https://www.mycronic.com/
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Mycronic AB (publ)**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

title: Senior AWS Cloud Developer, Solna
description:
**Do you want to work in a creative environment where you can make an impact? Apply to AWS Cloud Developer to PostNord in Stockholm!**
 As an AWS Cloud Developer at PostNord in Stockholm you will work in a modern tech stack and develop our booking solution as millions of people are affected all over the Nordic region. Some examples are PostNord Customer Portal, Skicka Direkt, PostNord App and the Postcards App. Live tracking, parcel robots and digital postage are some of the latest services we have developed. We look forward to hearing your ideas for our future solutions!
   

  

**The Opportunity**
* Work with our modern tech stack and be given great opportunities to influence the choice of technology.
* We encourage you to develop. For example, we sponsor you to AWS certify.
* A job where the value you deliver is crucial for our society.
* Wellness allowance and access to the office ́s gym and indoor swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord ́s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
* Great occupational pension terms.
* Great work-life balance with the possibility of a hybrid solution.


**Your Challenge**
 The team seeking your knowledge is the PostNord Booking Team. We are responsible for PostNord Group ́s digital booking solutions. These solutions are central to our growth. As a full-time developer with us you will be part of an agile team that has cutting-edge expertise in the area of booking solutions. We handle on average over 1 million API requests per day from satisfied customers from all over the Nordics.
   

  

**Some Of Our Technologies/techniques**
* AWS Microservices / Serverless.
* NodeJS / JavaScript / Typescript / Java
* Lambda, DynamoDB, Postgres, SQS, IAM, Fargate, S3, Elasticsearch to name a few.
* Swagger, Grafana, Bitbucket, XML/JSON, CI/CD


**The team and workplace**
 You will belong to a team of about 10 developers, who work with both front and back-end development. You will work from our office in Solna outside Stockholm and work hybrid with the opportunity to both work from the office and from home.
   

  

 Senior Developer’s part of this team has the position to take lead on specific projects and act as a representative for the PostNord Booking Team. The support of the team will always be very close if needed. This has been very appreciated by the team members.
   

  

**About You**
 We believe that you enjoy working in an agile environment where you get great opportunities to be involved and influence the work and the technical choices. We see that you have knowledge of working with cloud solutions, preferably in AWS, as well as knowledge of Node.JS, Java, Typescript and similar. Preferably you also have experience of being part of a team within a larger organization with many stakeholders.
   

  

 It is appreciated if you have an academic education in computer science or equivalent experience. We also see that you can communicate in English, both in speech and writing.
   

  

 It is appreciated if you possess all or some of the above requirements. However, the most important thing is your personal qualities. If you are committed, responsible and unpretentious and you love coding and bring value to the product you are working with, then we think you will fit in perfectly with us. We look forward to hearing more about you!
   

  

**PostNord**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We are looking forward to your application, if you have questions regarding the role you are welcome to contact annika.q.dahlstrom@postnord.com.
   

  

 We do not accept applications via mail.
   

  

 Click here for union contact

title: Development engineer Engine Aftertreatment Control
description:
The group Engine Aftertreatment Control software, responsible for the functionality of our catalysts and particulate filters, is now looking to add another function developer to the team. Our work includes control and diagnostics of the exhaust aftertreatment system in Traton’s powertrains and engine projects.
   

  

**Your work assignments**
 You will be responsible for functionalities related to aftertreatment components that you and your supporting colleagues will follow up on and ensure that Traton has the best product possible. Every day you will meet new challenges and you will early on get to influence, both your daily work and long-term projects. You will be able to develop functionality in your area, while also helping other groups with their problems. You will be part of the whole development cycle, from concept development to legacy support.
   

  

 We work both with development in C as well as model-based development using code generation through Simulink. An important part of the work is to develop analysis methods and models for the systems which we have responsibility for.
   

  

**Your Qualifications**
* We are looking for a person with a Master’s degree in Engineering with relevant specialization or someone with similar experience.
* You like to alternate between practical tests and analysis/evaluations.
* You like problem-solving and like to think creatively.
* You are triggered by "the impossible" and always want to try to find the best and most effective solution.
* You also appreciate to constantly improve tools and processes, which make the job more efficient.
* You have good communication skills and master both oral and written English and speak Swedish or have a desire to learn Swedish.


 You may have experience of working with calibration of engines, catalysts, or particulate filters in engine test cells. Experience in software testing is also very interesting, as well as knowledge of software development and MATLAB / Simulink is an advantage. But the most important thing is that you have the right attitude and are willing to learn new things.
   

  

**We offer**
 We offer an interesting and challenging job where there is plenty of scope for new ideas. Our corporate culture is characterized by openness, diversity and respect for the individual. Employees are our most important resource, so we invest in training our employees and giving them the opportunity to broaden their skills in order to be able to grow with us.
   

  

 If you do not have a heavy duty truck driving license (Swedish: C) today, you will have the chance to get it. As testing in trucks will support your SW verification.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a cover letter, CV, and copies of certificates.
   

  

 Selections will be made on an ongoing basis throughout the application period. A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

**For more information**
 Klara Lizarraga Manager, Phone +468-55353735
   

  

 E-mail: Klara.lizarraga@scania.com

title: Quality Engineer
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 DeLaval is now looking for a Quality Engineer to join us at the Quality and Compliance department in DeLaval. As a Quality Engineer you will act as a conductor between different units in the company to ensure cross functional work. There will be more reactive tasks as to solve problems as well as proactive tasks to prevent new problems to develop. This will be an opportunity to make a difference as well directly as in the future for the quality of our products.
   

  

 Quality and Compliance is part of Product Management & Development Unit (PMD). PMD has the responsibility to develop innovative and leading-edge solutions for dairy farmers around the world. The focus is on milking equipment, feeding and effluent handling, as well as various solutions for improved animal welfare and animal health, including smart solutions and technology (e.g., artificial intelligence) for cow monitoring and milk analysis.
   

  

**Purpose Of Role And Key Responsibilities**
* Participate in collection of feedback from the market on products to be sure to have fact-based data to be able to take right decisions. Be able to utilize a great understanding of Root Cause Analysis to be able to address not only symptoms, but the cause of the problem.
* Engage in the design, development and risk management activities in product development. (Especially when it comes to quality related matters regarding function.)
* Act as a bridge to other functions to ensure that the decided quality level of the products is withheld or improved before it is in use at the customer site.
* Review, create and update processes needed to sustain right quality level in our products.
* When needed, act as an internal auditor on internal processes that has impact on the quality outcome.


**Qualifications And Experience**
 To be successful in this role we see that you have:
   

  

* University degree in Bachelor of Science (or eqv.) as well as experience from quality or technical positions within manufacturing industries (mechanical or electronical).
* Experience from using problem solving tools and methodologies.
* Strong analytical problem solving and decision-making skills.
* Demonstrated ability to advocate for product excellence and quality.
* A curious and open mind-set and willingness to learn what is needed to achieve greatness.
* Experience from being involved in verification of chosen solutions (preferably from a quality perspective).
* Must be fluent in English, preferably also Swedish and/or Polish, other languages are a plus.


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours, Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* Market-based salary with an individual incentive program based on performance and company result.
* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours)
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary)
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year
* Private health insurance
* Flexible working hours and a global remote working policy that allows employees to work from home in agreement with their manager
* 30 days paid vacation


 The position is in Tumba, Sweden, global travelling will be part of this position, you will report to the Quality Assurance Manager.
   

  

**For Further Information, Please Contact**
 Ulrika Kihlander, Hiring Manager, 0736833670
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,700 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Senior DataOps Engineer
description:
Are you ready to elevate your career and become a part of a team that is transforming the way TRATON delivers exceptional software solutions to our customers? We are on the lookout for a Senior DataOps Engineer who is expert in data pipelines and enhancing data strategies to join our dynamic team. You will be working in a hybrid work-setting with exciting and complex software development!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We are dedicated to an inclusive and diverse workplace. You will join a diverse and competent team with a friendly, helpful and inclusive atmosphere. The team has a common vision of the goals and values, allowing us to take our jobs seriously while having fun at the same time. We care for each other’s personal development to learn, grow and evolve, in order to make our deliveries the best we can produce. Be yourself and reveal your talents!
   

  


**Your Role**
 In your role as a Senior DataOps Engineer, you are an essential contributor to our mission of establishing a world-class developer experience. You will scope, design, and implement developer experience focused on pipeline efficiency and infrastructure for a connected development loop inspired by Platform Engineering. The aim is to enable our engineers to validate and deploy their ideas within 24 hours of conception. Seize this opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on the industry!
   

  

 You will have the chance to contribute to our “developer platform” and “developer portal” initiatives. These elements are integral to any modern tech organization. You will collaborate with a skilled team to develop and sustain these vital components. You will also contribute to creating pipelines and supporting infrastructure to enable self-service workflows across these capabilities.
   

  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* You will work with DataOps in the whole chain from hardware to ML and LLM using modern approach and best practices to cater business needs for TRATON.
* You will create tools to aid in management and infrastructure of data.
* You will enhance the current pipelines and visualisation by integrating to the developer portal.
* You will encourage and improve knowledge sharing by working with peers from across the organization, sharing your experience, learning from others and contributing to our shared knowledge base.
* You will evaluate the performance of our solutions and seek ways to improve them.


  

  


**Qualifications**
* Programming experience in Python and scripting experience.
* Experience with containerization, Cloud Computing (AWS or Azure preferred), Kubernetes, Kafka and Graphana.
* Automation and orchestration experience including Terraform, Helm, GitLab CI, ArgoCD.
* Experience in setting up monitoring for infrastructure and applications with tools such as Prometheus, Datadog, OpenTelemetry.
* Experience in configuring and troubleshooting container environments.
* Experience in data driven development, preferably within the ML context.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


  

  

**Experience with the following is meritorious:**
* Developing pipelines for ML and LLM products.
* Working with Big data in an industrial context.
* Previous experience working with a data pipeline from distributed hardware to a central data store.
* Working collaboratively in an Agile/Scrum environment.


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**Further information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position please contact Mariette Annergren (Group Manager, EEDCD) at +46855353145.
   

  

 and Elvedin Ramic (Group Manager, EEDCE) +46855350687

title: Junior Asset Manager
description:
I am partnered with a fast growing, entrepreneurial developer who is seeking to hire a talented Junior Asset Manager, reporting to the Head of Wind. Our client owns and manages solar, wind, and battery storage assets across Europe, possessing a multi-GW development pipeline, with ambition to further diversify and expand the portfolio.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* KPI variance analysis and proactive identification of issues affecting performance issues.
* Ensure preventative maintenance is in line with O&M contract, ensuring completion of any corrective works.
* Support on regulatory, HSE compliance.
* Site visits where appropriate, delivering an inspection report, producing punch lists.
* Identifying, managing and resolving non‐ or low‐level technical incidents.
* Identify potential improvements and optimisation strategies.
* Improve efficiency, reporting and effective monitoring of assets.
* Ensuring complete and accurate record keeping, satisfactory completion of contract milestones.
* Providing support to the wider team and generally supporting team objectives
* Being part of the management system development


**Requirements / Qualifications**
* 1-3 years of relevant experience in Asset Management, O&M Management and/or in large-scale renewable projects
* Higher education with technical focus (Master of Engineering or equivalent)
* Understanding of (technical) asset management methodologies and experience in technical aspects of renewables assets.
* Critical eye for compliance and safety.
* Knowledge of IT Network, Databases, SCADA
* Strong MS Excel and IT skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
* Strong organisational and time management skills;
* Fluent in English


 If the above sounds of interest, please apply via the ‘Easy Apply’ button or alternatively, send your CV to snouri@leap29.com.

title: Norweigan Business Development Representatives to Reliable AB!
description:
Do you speak Norwegian and have an interest in customer relations and business development? If you are looking for a role where you can develop your sales ability and gain relevant experience, this is the role for you! Apply today as we work with ongoing selection.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Reliable AB
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Sales
 



  

**Extent :**
 Part time, 1-3 days a week, 50h/month minimum
 



  

**Start date :**
 End of August 2024
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Reliable AB staff develop their sales assignments with niche talent recruitment, directly from universities and colleges. They work in a youthful environment with unique conditions to be able to staff and optimize results for all types of sales assignments. Every customer contact is a marketing opportunity and they place great importance in the person who represents a customer always having a relevant education, knows the market, the company and the product it represents. In this role your main responsibility will be to book appointments for Reliable's customers, and offer them the best conditions for their business growth.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* **An exciting experience where you can develop your sales skills**
  
* **A dedicated consultant manager to help and guide you in your role and future career path**
  
* **A competitive salary with the possibility of a generous provision salary**
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Prospecting and lead generation: Identify and research potential clients or partners through various channels
  
* Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring exceptional service delivery
  
* Pipeline Management: Manage and update the CRM system, keeping accurate records of interactions, leads, and opportunities
  
* Booking meetings: Putting clients together with their prospects and organizing these meetings.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* An ongoing tertiary education, with at least one year left of studies, of at least 50% study rate
  
* High speaking and written proficiency in Norwegian
  
* An interest in business development, sales, and customer relations
  
* Previous experience from sales or customer service
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Self-developer
  
* Service-minded
  
* Results-oriented
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Reliable AB**

 Read more about Reliable AB here.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Emma Nydén or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth1@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105332

title: Backend-utvecklare till Söderberg & Partners!
description:
Som utvecklare hos Söderberg & Partners är du en del av ett stort internationellt bolag men med entreprenörsandan och de korta beslutsvägarna kvar. Här jobbar du i en modern utvecklingsorganisation som alltid strävar efter att utmana sig själva och tillsammans med dina kollegor jobbar ni för att skapa de bästa lösningarna inom fintech! Låter det som något för dig? Läs vidare!
 



  

**Företag :**
 PO Söderberg & Partner Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Söderberg & Partners är en av Sveriges ledande aktörer inom kapitalförvaltning och erbjuder rådgivning inom komplexa områden som exempelvis pension, företagsförsäkringar och förmögenhetsrådgivning till såväl privatpersoner som företag och institutioner. Idag har de, förutom i Sverige, även kontor i Danmark, Norge, Finland, Nederländerna, Luxemburg, Österrike och Spanien. Med anledning av expansion såväl nationellt som internationellt och att satsningar sker på flera håll inom bolaget behöver de bland annat anställa en utvecklare till ett av teamet inom Product Development.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Arbete i ett internationellt bolag med mycket goda utvecklingsmöjligheter
  
* Arbete i ett stort bolag men där entreprenörsandan finns kvar
  
* En kultur som tillåter alla att bidra med sina tankar och idéer
  
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och bra förmåner
  


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Teamet du kommer att tillhöra jobbar med utveckling av Söderberg & Partners kapitalrådgivningsprodukter. Användarna är främst interna medarbetare som jobbar med rådgivning men även en del kunder. Produktportföljen är bred och du kommer att jobba med många olika produkter och system vilket vi tror kommer bidra till din utveckling. Teamet består idag av 5 personer varav några utvecklare, en produktägare och din närmsta chef och ni jobbar alla tätt tillsammans för att hitta de bästa lösningarna. Du kommer att jobba med moderna tekniker och med fokus på back end-delen och utvecklingen sker främst i C# .NET. S&P jobbar i agila scrum-team och använder sitt egna SAFe-baserade ramverk SPACe. Förutom att du och dina kollegor jobbar tillsammans är teamet mån om att hitta dig som vill lära känna dina kollegor på såväl luncher som andra aktiviteter tillsammans för att bygga en stark sammanhållning.
   




**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och intresse för tjänsten. Motivera väl i din ansökan varför du valt att söka. Detta är en roll för dig som trivs med ett högt tempo, samarbete och som lockas av fintech-branschen!
 


  

  
* Har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område
  
* Har några års erfarenhet av utveckling i C# .NET
  
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska då båda språken används i arbetet
  
* Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom finans
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Placering: Stureplan och möjlighet till några dagars distansarbete/vecka
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Intervjuer med Academic Work
  
* Kodprov
  
* Intervjuer med S&P
  
* Referenser + beslut
  

  


**Bli direktrekryterad till PO Söderberg & Partner Aktiebolag**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
