title: Företag inom IT-infrastruktur söker Field Service Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Är du en tekniskt kunnig och lösningsorienterad person med erfarenhet inom datacenter? Vill du vara en del av ett innovativt företag som ligger i framkant av IT-infrastruktur och tekniska lösningar? På uppdrag av kund söker vi nu en driven och engagerad Field Service Infrastructure Engineer för att stärka deras team och bidra till deras fortsatta framgång. Om du brinner för att leverera högkvalitativ teknisk support och vill arbeta i en dynamisk och utvecklande miljö, då kan detta vara möjligheten för dig!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, Skift
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augusti
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 På uppdrag av kund söker vi nu en skicklig Field Service Infrastructure Engineer som kan arbeta på plats i deras kunders datacenter. Denna roll är avgörande för att tillhandahålla omfattande teknisk support till deras kunder och säkerställa smidig drift och distribution av kritisk datacenterinfrastruktur. Du kommer att bestå av ett team med nio kollegor med en spridning mellan kontoren i Borås och Stockholm. Det kan förekomma även förekomma jobb på annan ort.
 


  


 Kunden är ett ledande teknikföretag specialiserat på avancerade datacenterlösningar och IT-infrastruktur. De levererar tjänster inom bland annat datacenterinfrastruktur och IT-drift, säkra kommunikationslösningar, containertjänster, service och support 24/7, säkerhetslösningar, applikationsdrift och tredjepartsservice. De har strategiska partnerskap med ledande tillverkare och referenslösningar hos flera av Nordens mest krävande IT-verksamheter i både den privata och offentliga sektorn.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En dynamisk och stimulerande arbetsmiljö.
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt.
  
* Möjligheter till vidareutbildning och professionell utveckling.
  
* En tillsvidareanställning via Academic Work med fast månadslön. Goda möjligheter till överrekrytering efter 6 månader.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Incidenthantering för kontinuerlig drift.
  
* Hantering av olika datacenteraktiviteter, såsom att byta ut nätverksenheter, konfigurera servrar, utföra strömcykler och hantera kabeldragning/patchhantering.
  
* Generera periodiska rapporter enligt kundens specifikationer.
  
* Tillhandahålla logistiskt stöd för tillgångshantering och datacenterplanering.
  
* Delta i felanalys enligt anvisningar från kundens ingenjörsteam.
  
* Resor inom tjänsten kan förekomma
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har examen inom ett datorrelaterat område (datorvetenskap, elektroteknik, telekommunikation eller liknande).
  
* Har 2 till 5 års relevant teknisk support-erfarenhet.
  
* Har stark kunskap om lagring, nätverk och serverhårdvara.
  
* Är en lagspelare
  
* Innehar B-körkort
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Certifiering inom CompTIA A+ eller motsvarande, CompTIA Server+ eller motsvarande, MCP/MCSE-certifiering.
  
* Bred erfarenhet inom nätverk och hårdvara
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Flexibel
  
* Kommunikativ
  
* Noggrann
  
* Problemlösare
  
* Prestigelös
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sophia Gyllenhammar eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105308

title: Quality Engineer
description:
**Quality Engineer - Automotive Industry** 




 We live and breathe innovation – We enjoy the ride
 



  





*CabinAir aims to improve the health, safety, and wellbeing of drivers and passengers, by producing industry-leading in-cabin air purification solutions for cars, trucks, buses, and other vehicles.* 




  





*We are looking for a Quality Engineer within Automotive to be part of our journey when we expand our businesses.* 




  





**What you'll do** 




*As Quality Engineer, you will contribute to and ensure, in strong collaboration with other departments, that our Management System (Quality, Environment, Health & Safety and Information Security) meets relevant international standards and customer requirements, as well that it continuously improves.* 




  





**Overall responsibilities** 



* Lead and support Quality Assurance initiatives in projects, following Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) processes and Automotive SPICE requirements for software development projects.
* Internal Audits:
* Conduct internal process, product, and environmental audits to identify areas for improvement.
* Collaborate with relevant departments to implement corrective and preventive actions based on audit findings.
* Supplier Audits:
* Plan and execute supplier process, product, and environmental audits to ensure compliance with quality and environmental standards.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with suppliers to drive continuous improvement.
* Customer Claim Handling:
* Investigate and analyse customer claims using problem-solving methods such as 8D, 5 Why's, fishbone analysis, and Fault Tree Analysis (FTA).
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement corrective actions and prevent recurrence.



  





**Who you are** 




 We are seeking a dynamic quality minded and experienced Quality Engineer with practical experience in automotive quality standards, particularly IATF 16949 and its core tools. The ideal candidate should possess a strong background in quality assurance in projects aligned with APQP (Advanced Product Quality Planning), and preferably Automotive SPICE (Software Process Improvement and Capability Determination). The candidate should also be proficient in conducting internal audits and supplier audits to ensure compliance with quality standards and continuous improvement. Experience from VDA 6.3 process audits, VDA Quality standards and ISO 14001 is a bonus.
 



  





 Regular international travel is an important part of the job.
 



  





 You will report to the Global Head of Quality but work closely with all other departments on all international CabinAir sites.
 



  





**Who we are** 




 We are proud to be pioneers. From the start, we’ve had the most advanced air purification technology. We are constantly experiencing the joy of innovation as we challenge conventional thinking, and we are dedicated to delivering solutions that contribute to the health and well-being of drivers and passengers everywhere. Based at Headquarter in Stockholm where all functions are represented, we are an international fast expanding team of passionate and committed employees with factory and R&D in Shenzhen and sales offices in Shanghai and Los Angeles. In total, we are about 80 passionate CabinAir employees.
 



  





 Our technology is already on the road in Volvo Cars, some of the world’s most highly regarded vehicles in terms of driver and passenger health and safety, as an integral part of Volvo Cars’ Advanced Air Cleaner (AAC) system. Recently Polestar announced AAC for Polestar 3 and we recently signed other contracts with premium vehicle manufacturers from Europe. U.S and China. In parallel, we are launching our technology for cars already on the road.
 







  





**The next step** 




 Do you find this interesting, and do you agree with our values Proud, Quality, Character and Dedicated? If yes, please send your application as soon as possible, not later than 15 September 2024 (interviews take place continuously). If you are offered the position, we will request a background check from the police.
 



  









 Please note that all applicants must possess a valid work permit and visa that authorizes them to work in Sweden. CabinAir does not provide assistance or sponsorship for obtaining these documents.
 



  









 We accept only direct job applications for this position (not through recruiting or staffing agencies).
 



  









 We bring you healthy air for the ride. And the journey has only begun!
 







  





**Apply today to join the ride!**

title: C++ utvecklare till spännande uppdrag i Arboga
description:
Vi söker dig som har skaffat dig erfarenhet av utveckling i C++, intresserad av att arbeta i ett leveransteam mot kund och vill lära dig mer om helhetsleveranser.
   

  

 Du har antingen utbildat dig och/eller som många av oss gått i livets teknikskola där utvecklandet/skapandet är din hobby lika mycket som ditt arbete.
   

  

**Metricio**
 Metricio värnar om våra kunder och anställda, för våra kunder handlar det om partnerskap och långsiktiga relationer, för våra anställda handlar det om personlig utveckling och ett ständigt lärande.
   

  

 Metricio övervakar Sverige och Svensk infrastruktur, vi utvecklar ständigt nya funktioner, både genom att använda modern och innovativ teknik från etablerade bolag och även genom egen utveckling av funktioner och flöden.
   

  

**Vår leverans**
 Metricio är ett av Sveriges ledande bolag inom drift- och tjänsteövervakning med fokus på ny teknik och innovativa lösningar. Våra medarbetare är ledande experter inom området, vilket är anledningen till att flera av de största organisationerna i Sverige valt oss som partner.
   

  

 Metricios produktkatalog består till stor del av open source-lösningar där vi levererar funktioner, tjänster, och nytta till våra kunder. I din roll som utvecklare på Metricio kommer vi erbjuda dig möjlighet att fördjupa dina kunskaper inom följande produkter och lösningar för drift och automation:
   

  

* Zabbix
* Grafana
* Elastic
* Logstash
* Kibana
* IBM Netcool
* Ansible
* Docker


**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Din roll som utvecklare är att designa, utveckla, införa och förvalta lösningar hos kund. Våra egenutvecklade tjänster i kombination med opensource-lösningar ger våra kunder kostnadseffektiva och hållbara lösningar över tid. Du är lyhörd för att ta hand om kundens behov och önskemål, du kommer även med egna ideer och förslag.Vi arbetar ute hos kund, på vårt kontor i Kista eller på hemmaplan allt beroende på kund och arbetsuppgift. Du kommer jobba i projekt där arbetskollegor kan komma från många bolag där vi alla har olika kompetens och arbetsuppgifter. Metricios kunder återfinns i många branscher med en gemensam nämnare, de vill få koll på sin lägesbild och produktionsdata. Din roll är en viktig del i produktionen av tjänster till våra kunder.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 För att vara trygg i din roll behöver du ha några års erfarenhet av arbete eller studier där du fått en bred IT-kunskap. Du behöver besitta kunskaper inom:
   

  

* God kunskap inom C / C++
* God kunskap inom IP (TCP/UDP), Subnetting, Routing, DHCP , DNS
* God kunskap inom SNMP
* Grundläggande kunskap Syslog
* Vana att jobba i Linux/Unix


 Meriterande:
   

  

* God kunskap inom API / Rest
* Javascript, NodeJS
* Python
* Bash
* React, Angular
* .NET
* Versionshantering av kod i tex Git / Github
* Webserviceintegrationer och API:er
* Nätverk och IT-infrastruktur


 Vi ser också att du har B-körkort eftersom resor kan förekomma i tjänsten.
   

  

 Eftersom vi lyder under säkerhetsskyddsavtal hos de flesta av våra kunder krävs det att du är svensk medborgare och inför en anställning kommer du att få genomgå en bakgrundskontroll.

title: Leadership Technical Program Manager, Google Meet
description:
**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 8 years of technical program management work experience.
* 5 years of experience in leadership role(s) with/without direct reports.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 8 years of experience managing cross-functional/team projects.
* 5 years of supervisory experience.


**About The Job**
 Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.
   

  

 Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage various Engineering-specific programs and teams.
   

  

 Google Meet has the mission to help consumers, educators, small businesses, Googlers, and Fortune 500 companies leverage the power of videoconferencing to enhance their connections with friends, classmates, and co-workers.
   

  

 The Foundation team is focused on providing world-class audio & video media, stunning reliability, security, and a setup enabling natural communications - like being in the same room.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Implement communications standards across a portfolio of programs including executive and key partner communications.
* Establish a reliable and visible cadence for program reviews, decision-making, prioritization, and Resource Stewardship (effective deployment of machine and people resources) whereby improvements such as efficiency and utilization gains are measurable and the impact can be felt organization wide.
* Lead a governance structure that drives effective executive decision-making. Ensure governance structure effectively exposes and mitigates dependencies.
* Seek out and identify change management opportunities that increase program velocity and which affect multiple teams. Apply governance over change management to ensure it’s used effectively.
* Define/manage a program portfolio solving problems that target high business impact for the organization and product area.


 Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.
   

  

 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the users we serve, creating a culture of belonging, and providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), expecting or parents-to-be, criminal histories consistent with legal requirements, or any other basis protected by law. See also Google's EEO Policy, Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal, Belonging at Google, and How we hire.
   

  

 If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.
   

  

 Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles unless stated otherwise in the job posting.
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees, or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 



  




* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **400 million** 
 active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth
 
 with
 
 high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv
 **with high ambitions** 
 .



  





**We at The Search team,** 
 are responsible for some of the most vital and impactful features of the Truecaller application. These include:
 



  




* **Caller Identification** 
 : Identifying who is calling and making sure users can take educated decisions to pick up or not
* **Spam Protection:** 
 Identifying and blocking spam numbers, calculating spam likelihood, and enhancing overall spam detection.
* **Name Accuracy:** 
 Guarantee that users see the most accurate and reliable names associated with numbers.
* **Fraud Protection:** 
 Developing and maintaining services to protect users from fraudulent calls and scams.



  





**As a Senior Backend Engineer in the Search team** 
 , you will collaborate with a dedicated team responsible for maintaining some of Truecaller's most essential services. These include the search engine that powers caller identification, the systems that manage spam protection, the services that handle user comments and fraud protection services, among other critical functions.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




  




* Collaborate with a cross-disciplinary team to design, develop, and maintain highly scalable and available backend systems.
* Play a key role in managing critical contact identification and spam-blocking backend systems that serve hundreds of millions of users.
* Monitor and optimize system performance to ensure reliability and efficiency at a large scale.



  





**What you bring in:** 




  




* Strong background in Java and/or Scala
* Experience working with distributed systems
* Experience working with data-intensive applications
* Good understanding of data structures and algorithms
* Good English skills, both oral and written
* The drive to learn and develop as a professional



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 




  




* Experience building systems in the cloud
* Experience with virtualization environments, e.g. Docker
* Experience with systems for managing containerized applications, e.g. Kubernetes
* Experience with non-relational databases



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Do it your way** 
 : We work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days.
* **Office life:** 
 Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun in our playroom! As well as in our exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, and Geek lunch!



  





**Come as you are:** 




  





 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you**

title: HR Administratör
description:
**Om Norla:** 




 Norla är ett IT- och Managementkonsultföretag som drivs av kundnöjdhet. Vi arbetar i en mångkulturell miljö och vi drivs av vår princip "Mind and Heart". Vi värdesätter att våra relationer med medarbetarna säkerställer deras professionella tillväxt och framgång. Vi arbetar tillsammans i ett nätverk av stora företag för att hitta de bästa talangerna för att stödja våra kunder.
 



  





 ---
 



  





 I denna roll kommer du att stötta rekryteringsprocesser hos vår kund genom att hantera administrativa uppgifter, inklusive avtalshantering, bokning av intervjuer och att avlasta rekryterande chefer i deras dagliga arbete.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join Kambi’s Data Platform stream to support us in building a decentralized and self-serviced data platform, contributing to our Data Mesh journey. We believe in the high importance of data in every organization, and we are committed to empowering Kambi’s businesses through our solution.
   

  

**The Role And Responsibilities**
 As a Data Engineer, you will help shape our data platform by connecting modern data mesh principles with the practical aspects of our current warehousing solution.
   

  

 You will initially join the Data Warehouse team, however as we move forward with next delivered data products you may find yourself to work in smaller, cross-functional teams with Data Engineers and Analytics Engineers, focusing on a particular area of our unified data platform.
   

  

 We believe that you have valuable experience in data modelling and transformations, which will help you understand business requirements and how they translate into data models. Experience with dbt or other modern tools will be beneficial.
   

  

 As we aim to shift from Data Warehouse towards Lakehouse concept, we expect that you will be familiar with CI/CD and cloud infrastructure solutions appropriate for data platform. At Kambi we work with AWS tools, we use Airflow for orchestration, and we have recently rebuilt our Data Lake with the use of Iceberg and Trino.
   

  

 Languages that we are looking for are Python and SQL for your daily work, and English for communication with your colleagues.
   

  

**Is Kambi a place for you?**
 We highly value soft skills such as collaboration, communication, and problem-solving abilities. Our teams have a high level of autonomy in decisions around solutions and ways of working. You will thrive in this role if you are curious, enjoy technical discussions with your team and willing to collaborate to find the most suitable solution.
   

  

 We offer friendly, welcoming, and inclusive working culture in an international work environment. We value learning and development, both on an individual level and as a whole organization. It is important for us that we grow together. We like to have fun with our colleagues, but we also understand that each employee needs their flexibility to thrive.
   

  

**And one last thing...**
 We would be happy if you tick off all our boxes, yet we also believe it is just as important we tick off all of yours. And if you think you have most of what we are looking for, but not every single thing, go ahead and hit apply. We would still love to hear from you!
   

  

 We want a balance between office work and working from home. We believe we will all gain from the best of both worlds, so the way of working in Kambi is hybrid – we want to have a chance to work with you in our Stockholm office 2 days in a week.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

title: Test & Commissioning Engineer to leading company in the railway industry!
description:
Are you a detail-oriented engineer with a passion for ensuring the safety and efficiency of cutting-edge rail systems? On behalf of our client, we're looking for a Testing and Commissioning Engineer to play a key role in bringing their innovative transportation solutions to life. If you thrive in dynamic environments and have solid experience in field signal technology within the railway industry, this could be your dream job - Apply today!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Our client is a world-leading supplier of railway systems, committed to creating a long-term sustainable transportation system. Here, you will join a secure and skilled workplace that values an inclusive and responsible culture. This culture forms the foundation of the company's commitment to helping its employees grow, learn, and advance in their careers.
 


  


 As a Test & Commissioning Engineer you are offered a varied role where you will work with testing and commissioning of electrical motors and gearboxes to ensure they meet industry standards and specifications. You will conduct functional tests, load tests, and performance evaluations to verify the proper operation of motors and gearboxes and also install our client's equipment in the field.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* An exciting workplace with an international touch
  
* A meaningful role at a company with a focus on sustainability
  
* A dedicated consultant manager who acts as your business partner and support throughout the entire process
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Signal engineering background (in field) with at least 2 years of experience
  
* Experience in installing signaling equipment
  
* Able to communicate fluently in English
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.

 Hanna Agbelin or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106322

title: Lab Engineer for leading company in renewable solutions
description:
A leading company in renewable materials is seeking a junior Laboratory Engineer for their lab in Sickla. If you are passionate about lab work and eager to contribute to a sustainable future, this role could be for you!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Sickla, Nacka
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, until the end of 2024
 



  

**Start date :**
 2 september
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 In this role, you'll dive into exciting lab work, performing various material characterization methods and tests of fiber-based products and raw materials. The focus is on material assessment and clear documentation in lab notebooks or Excel. You will receive a good introduction and the role is suitable for you who are junior in your career or freshly graduated.
 


  


 You'll be part of a dynamic team, working with colleagues on innovative fibre-based materials projects. Safety and precision are key, and previous lab experience will set you up for success. This assignment is from the beginning of September until the end of 2024.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* **Great Company Culture:**
 Collaborate with friendly colleagues in a multi-cultural environment.
  
* **Innovative Projects:**
 Work with renewable materials and cutting-edge technologies.
  
* **Consultant manager:**
 A supportive consultant manager from Academic Work who will help you further in your career.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Conduct a variety of material characterization tests.
  
* Assess materials and document results clearly using lab notebooks or Excel.
  
* Contribute to innovative projects involving fiber-based materials, ensuring safety and precision.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Education within a relevant area
  
* Lab experience, could be a previous job or internship
  
* Knowledge of reporting lab results in notebooks or Excel
  
* Very good knowledge of English, both speaking and writing since it's used in daily work. Swedish is a plus.
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Orderly
  
* Flexible
  
* Responsible
  


  


 We are looking for a detail-oriented and organized individual who can present results and communicate findings clearly. The ideal candidate should be proactive, open, and able to work collaboratively across various touchpoints. Strong teamwork skills, a systematic approach, and the ability to quickly learn new tasks are essential for this role.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
