title: Maskinförare till Lycksele/Malå
description:
*Vill du jobba med något som är viktigt på riktigt? Vi erbjuder dig skogen – ett av våra viktigaste verktyg för att klara utmaningar kopplade till klimatförändringar och framtidens råvaruförsörjning. Dessutom en vacker arbetsplats. För att motverka hotet från klimatförändringar och mot den biologiska mångfalden behöver vi skogsmark och skogsråvara. Sveaskog är statens skogsbolag och vår uppgift är att förvalta skogsmarken. För att klara detta på ett långsiktigt hållbart sätt har Sveaskog antagit ett program för hållbart skogsbruk. Nu behöver vi fler intresserade och kompetenta människor som vill vara med på den resan. Kanske är du den vi söker?*
**Vi söker nu maskinförare till Älvalaget i Lycksele/Malå**
**Om tjänsten**
 Som skogsmaskinförare jobbar du mot mål gällande kvalitet, uppföljning, produktion, miljö och naturvård. Du är en viktig del i en hel kedja där kraven är höga på noggrannhet och ansvarstagande. På Sveaskog ser vi alla våra roller som lika viktiga i kedjan och Teamet och vi jobbar efter att göra varandra bättre.
   

  

 Du kommer tillhöra ett självgående arbetslag bestående av 4 maskinförare som arbetar i skift med huvudinriktning slutavverkning. Tjänsten innehåller ansvarsområden som i viss mån kan anpassas efter din kompetens och dina styrkor. Du kommer att ha lokal kontakt mot åkerier, maskinverkstäder, områdesansvariga och vägentreprenörer.
   

  

**Maskinlaget är baserat i Lycksele produktionsområde och verkar i huvudsak norr om Lycksele varpå möjlig stationering kan vara i Lycksele eller Malå.**
**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som tycker om ditt arbete och har ett genuint intresse för maskiner, service och underhåll. Du är beredd att köra både skördare och skotare. Du är inte rädd att använda IT-utrustning och ser administration som en del av ditt arbete. Du är intresserad av och tar ett stort ansvar i ditt arbete som står för skogens olika värden så som produktion, skötsel och naturvård.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper där Sveaskogs värdeord
 *Ansvar, Mod och Nyfikenhet* 
 speglar mycket vem vi söker. Som maskinförare är du en viktig länk i värdekedjan, och du ser möjligheter och förbättringar som drivs av våra värdeord.
   

  

 Du har en gymnasial skoglig utbildning eller motsvarande erhållna kunskaper. En del av arbetet sker digitalt varför datakunskap är en viktig del i arbetet. Körkort B är ett krav.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 För information om tjänsten kontakta Produktionsansvarig Nils Nilsson 070-2221870 eller Intraprenör My Granbom 072-2333631.
   

  

 För facklig information kontakta Lars Djerf (GS-Facket). 070-2634350
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Välkommen att söka jobbet senast 9 Sep
 **.**
*Sveaskog eftersträvar mångfald och en jämn könsfördelning inom alla yrken i företaget.*

title: Analyst, Debt Capital Markets | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Debt Capital Markets (DCM) is responsible for the origination, structuring, execution and syndication of a wide range of debt-related products, including bonds and asset-backed securities issued by Corporate entities, Government Institutions, Financial Institutions and Sponsors. The unit operates from offices in the Nordic capitals and from Frankfurt and London with professionals providing both specific product and sector expertise. We are now looking for an Analyst to join the High Yield & Convertible origination team within DCM in Stockholm.
   

  

**About the role:**
 You will be responsible for supporting origination, structuring, and execution activities of funding and capital transactions for target High Yield & Convertible clients of SEB. You will participate in the origination process as well as providing input on new business opportunities.
   

  

 As an Analyst you will
   

  

* Be responsible for preparing high quality pitches, marketing material and financial modelling
* Keep maintenance of market intelligence and market data
* Participate in the idea generation for new business opportunities
* Participate in the development and implementation of strategy for various DCM products


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
 In addition to strong academic results and analytical skills we value an outgoing personality and team player mentality, integrity, high work capacity and a genuine interest in financial markets. You are a recent graduate or have up to 2 years’ experience from similar positions or a role within investment banking, financing, management consulting, with strong skills in financial modelling and power point.
   

  

 You show commitment to learn and constantly develop your skill set, and you work in a structured way with focus on quality, details, and deadlines.
   

  

 We operate as a global team where seamless communication and collaboration with other units across the bank is key to our success. Fluency in English is a requirement, and basic knowledge in a Scandinavian language is preferred.
   

  

**What we offer:**
 SEB offers an attractive and international learning environment. We aim to attract exceptional individuals with a desire to grow their own skillset as well as provide exceptional service to their clients. You will work side by side with a diverse team of experienced colleagues and get the chance to build strong network internally as well as externally.
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe and where they come from.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and why you believe this position is right for you. Candidates will be reviewed and selected on an ongoing basis, and you are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 10 September 2024 . Should you have any questions regarding the position you can reach out to Sofie Brandemark, on sofie.brandemark@seb.se or Joakim Isaksson, Talent Acquisition Partner, on joakim.isaksson@seb.se. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Projektledare
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker nu en erfaren projektledare till vår affärsenhet Global Technology Operations (GTO) och enheten Dedicated Client Projects (DCP), som skräddarsyr smarta konsultlösningar för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär som senior projektledare i en trygg och stabil miljö? Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta i ett stort multinationellt företag med välfungerande strukturer och seniora kompetenta kollegor.
   

  

 Du kommer att leda viktiga projekt för våra kunder, som oftast är stora företag eller myndigheter. Här får du chansen att lära dig mycket och arbeta med komplexa, utmanande uppdrag, som kommer att inspirera dig varje dag.
   

  

 Välkommen till en arbetsplats där din erfarenhet och kompetens värdesätts, och där du kan växa tillsammans med oss!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som projektledare kommer du att leda och delta i projektteam för att säkerställa effektiv leverans och hög kvalitet.
   

  

 Du kommer även att:
   

  

* Bygga och underhålla relationer med kunder, kollegor och leverantörer.
* Kommunicera effektivt med olika intressenter och säkerställa att projekten håller tidsplan och budget.
* Koordinera och genomföra projekt, både interna och externa uppdrag.
* Arbeta med IT-infrastruktur och tekniska lösningar för att möta kundernas behov.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi tänker att du har minst 5-års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som projektledare för tekniska IT-projekt, gärna inom IT-infrastruktur. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att självständigt driva hela projekt, och haft kontakt med beställaren.
   

  

* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ITIL
* Goda kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift


 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav eftersom tjänsten kan vara placerad i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med applikation, server och lagring.
   

  

**To applicants: please note that this position requires Swedish language skills on a professional level, verbally as well as in writing.**
**Vi är flexibla och hybrida!**
 Du kommer att ha en varierad vardag med möjligheten att utföra arbete hos kunden, på något av CGI kontor i Stockholm eller på distans från hemmet, beroende på kundens önskemål och krav. De flesta av våra konsulter arbetar i en hybridlösning, vilket innebär att du kan kombinera arbete på plats och på distans för att skapa en optimal balans mellan arbetsliv och privatliv.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Om du har några frågor eller funderingar, kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Marcus Grindange via mail: marcus.grindange@cgi.com.
   

  

**Mer information om våra förmåner:**
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Community Associate
description:
**Receptionists**
 At Spaces, we call our receptionists Community Associates. Our customers come to us for an inspiring work environment. As one of our receptionists, you’ll help deliver it. How? By providing sparkling service. Going the extra mile. And making sure everyone who visits us feels totally at home.
   

  

**A typical day at Spaces**
 You arrive 15 minutes before your centre opens to make sure everything is ready to go. You make it your responsibility to order the first cappuccino of the day at the bar and make your round through the business club to make sure all lights are turned on and the place looks tidy.
   

  

 Slowly, the first members start to arrive and one of them asks you for the changed WiFi code. Afterwards, while digging through your emails, a guest walks in and says she’s coming to provide training in one of the meeting rooms. You check the meeting room agenda and notice that almost all of the meeting rooms will be occupied today. You take her to the right meeting room, but you find out that our catering partner forgot to put coffee in the room and make sure that this is still done.
   

  

 A bit later, a member asks you if his mail has already arrived; he’s expecting a really important letter. Later that morning, the mail comes in and you put it in the corresponding mailboxes - and send an email to the member that came by earlier, saying that his mail arrived and that it’s waiting for him in his mailbox.
   

  

 After a hectic morning, it’s time for lunch. You grab a homemade soup and a healthy salad together with your favourite colleagues in the restaurant.
   

  

 After lunch, you sit down with the Community Manager to discuss the organisation of next week’s summer event. However, he mentions that one of the members just had a baby. You take it upon yourself to organise an act of kindness from Spaces, and to congratulate the parents of the new-born. Once you’re done with ordering, a guest pops by to sign up for a membership. Because your Sales colleague isn’t available right now, you help the guest with the online registration. Once the registration is done, you immediately hook her up with a badge (and immediately arrange one for the new employee on the 4th floor who just emailed you as well).
   

  

 At 6:00pm, it’s time to gently ask the large group in meeting room 3 to wrap it up. Maybe they would like to join us for drinks at our weekly Friday drinks, or you direct them to that nice nearby restaurant you know so that they can grab a bite. Once the last people have left the building, and everything’s left behind nice and tidy, you head home to enjoy your evening
   

  

**Bring your personality to work**
 We Look For People Who Are Sociable And Outgoing And Who Can Bring Their Own Style To Our Fun, Thriving Work Environment. You Also Need To Be
   

  

* Super customer-focused
* A great team player
* Someone who takes good care of their appearance
* Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages


**Last but not least**
**On Top Of a Competitive Salary Package We Offer**
* An inspiring work environment with room for your ideas
* Lots of social events you won’t want to miss
* Training and development

title: Principal Vulnerability Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a Principal Vulnerability Engineer who will be part of the security vulnerability team for the Java platform. This team conducts both the red team (offensive) and blue team (defensive) duties. Responsibilities will include proactive research, security tooling, assessments, and assisting development teams with security code review. Qualified candidate must have at least 10+ years of hands-on experience in platform security, deep knowledge of Java security model is a must. Minimum 10+ years of hands-on experience with security protocols and best practices are required. Ideal candidate is expected to work independently on assigned tasks. Proven past experience in successful security incident resolution and proactive research utilizing industry standard tools is a must-have. Past research and CVEs on Java security issues are a plus. Must have proficiency in Java, and expert level C/C++ skills, and systems level programming. Great personal leadership, self-starter, ability to work with remote teams and communication skills are required.
   

  

 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Responsibilities will include proactive research on new vulnerability signatures for the Java platform, create and maintain security tooling for the Java platform, conduct security assessment for new features that will be integrated into the JDK, and assisting development teams with security code review.
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Senior Backend Engineer (PHP)
description:
**About Gelato** 




 Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.
 



 We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.
 



 Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.
 



  





**Gelato Technology** 




 We own no physical production assets, nor servers, instead our asset is a cloud based connectivity platform that enables world-class on-demand production for e-commerce platforms and applications. This engineered platform needs to provide our customers access to more than 130 production partners in 32 countries and includes production plate design, routing to an appropriate partner, finally linking to logistics’ systems for delivery to the consumer. All this in 72 hours and reaching more than 5 billion people and potential consumers in a smarter, faster, and greener way.
 



 The employed technologies range from backends using PHP and GoLang to mobile apps built natively or with hybrid technology, running on cloud services and with a modern CI/CD pipeline. Designing highly-available, fault-tolerant, cost-effective, scalable systems is our passion. We are using TDD, BDD, DDD principles and patterns, and agile methodology. Designing public API for millions of people, integrating with world-class third-party systems, and solving complex engineering problems (Graph, CAP, etc) are only a small glimpse into the tasks.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 



* Using the latest technologies to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scale
* Collaborating closely with other engineers as a valuable member of a cross-functional team
* Sharing your knowledge and building creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices
* Designing, developing, and deploying backend services with a focus on high availability, low latency, and scalability
* Taking end-to-end responsibility for the services that are owned by your team, including taking part in an on-call rotation



  





**Who you are** 



* A programming language agnostic having 5+ years of experience in a similar role
* Having a minimum of B.S. degree in Information Technology or Computer Sciences
* Able to adapt, change and grow quickly as we scale the organization
* Passionate about engineering practices like agile, continuous delivery, test-driven development, traceability, and observability
* Growth mentality, are curious and not afraid to be experimental.
* You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around you
* Solid experience as an Engineer designing, developing, and maintaining API driven solutions
* Strong communication skills, high integrity, and great attention to detail



  





**Possess knowledge and experience, or have an interest in working with:** 



* Docker and Kubernetes
* PHP (Symfony)
* Microservices architecture
* PostgreSQL, Elastic search, RabbitMQ
* Memcache, Redis
* ELK, Jaeger, Prometheus & Grafana



  





**What it’s like to work at Gelato** 




 We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.
 



 At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces
 **at least three days a week** 
 , allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.
 



 Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in
 **English** 
 , regardless of which country you are applying from.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**This is Readly** 




 Readly offers unlimited access to thousands of national and international magazines and newspapers, all in one app. We’ve partnered with 1,000+ publishers, providing readers with 8,000+ titles. We’re a value-driven ecosystem committed to unlocking a world of editorial content. Our goal is to boost journalistic content consumption through digitalisation, while minimizing our climate impact. With a dedicated team of 100+ professionals in Sweden, Germany and the UK, we’re making magazines and trusted journalism more accessible.
 



  





**Data and Analytics @ Readly** 




 The data and analytics team is based in Sweden (either Stockholm or Växjö) but works towards all markets, providing actionable insights and data-driven services and models to marketing, content, product, management and finance departments. The analytics team consists of data engineers, data analysts and data scientists and we work cross-functionally with business, product and tech stakeholders. We value work/life balance but also believe that we grow and develop when we meet which is why we have a few mandatory days when we work from the office together.
 



  





**About your role:** 




 We are looking for a curious and driven data scientist/ML engineer to help continue Readly’s strive towards a data driven organization. You will have the opportunity to make a big difference in all areas of the company and will come across projects that will help our customers to find the most relevant content for them and to find their way in the app. Or projects that help business managers understand who might be a potential customer and predict trends in the market and customer behavior.
 



  





 You will need to take a high degree of ownership for the end-to-end process from idea to productionised solution and you will need a few years of work experience from a similar role to accomplish this. That said, the team strives to help and learn from each other and to share both challenges and successes, so you will not be alone in your responsibilities. The role gives you great opportunities to influence both technical and business decisions.
 



  





**Key role responsibilities** 



* Work with teams and stakeholders to identify business opportunities and how to realize them using data and machine learning
* Translate business and product needs into technical requirements
* Develop new and manage existing data models and pipelines
* Develop, deploy and maintain machine learnings models and workflows in production, we currently use AWS sagemaker and fargate, terraform, dbt and snowflake



  





**Required Experience & skills** 



* A BSc or higher in a relevant field such as Engineering, Data/Computer Science, Statistics or other quantitative field.
* Strong skills and interest in statistical analysis and machine learning/AI
* Minimum 4 years working experience in a similar role
* Experienced in Python programming in a professional setting. (or extensive experience in other languages combined with knowledge of python)
* SQL experience
* Experience from end-to-end data science for product development (e.g. recommendation engines, user segmentation, content classification) or for marketing/customer relations (e.g. marketing optimisation, customer life-time value, churn propensity)
* Good communication skills and ability to lead discussions related to Data Science opportunities
* Must already be eligible to work from either the Stockholm or Växjö offices, we do not offer relocation or visa assistance



  





**It is a big bonus if you also have one or more of the following** 



* Architectural skills or experience in MLops
* Experience with data science and machine learning on the AWS platform
* Experience with infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines
* Extensive Data modeling/data engineering skills



  





 And most important of all is a curious mindset and a willingness and interest to learn and expand your skill set.
 



  





 Readly has been listed on the Allbright list three years in a row for having a gender balanced management team. In addition we are very proud to also have a 50/50 gender split among our employees and managers. We encourage people of all genders, ethnicities and ages to apply. If you think the role sounds like a good match for you and want to join us on our journey we would love to learn more about you. Don’t hesitate to get in touch!

title: Senior Sales Manager - Gaming
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the team** 





 The Gaming Sales team plays a crucial role in our organization's success by helping increase our merchant base in the gambling industry. The team is responsible for the full sales cycle from lead generation and prospecting to supporting the merchants go live with Trustly. The Senior Sales Manager will report directly to VP Gaming and will be a key member of the Gaming commercial team, and also work closely with the Account Development team based in Stockholm and other internal teams (Product, Marketing, Integrations, Legal, Compliance).
 








**About the role** 





 The purpose of this role is to facilitate sales activities focused on revenue growth across Europe by expanding Trustly’s gambling merchant base. The objective of the Senior Sales Manager is to identify new merchant opportunities among online gambling operators, create a sizeable pipeline of potential clients, fully own the sales cycle and successfully conclude negotiations with key target merchants that will drive new revenue for the company. 
 





  




**What you'll do** 
* Manage and own the entire sales cycle, from lead generation and prospecting, to comfortably presenting our services in meetings and contract execution
* Establish a strong pipeline of gambling operator opportunities across European markets
* Work closely with the Integration team making sure our customers implement our services and go live
* Make sure to have a high sales activity output
* Work closely with Trustly’s Gaming Account Management and Partnership teams and external partners such as PSPs and PAM platforms to distribute our value proposition and drive sales activity
* Participate in and contribute to all relevant industry marketing activities, including conferences, external events and meet ups
* With these efforts establish the business as a market and thought leader and open up avenues for the identification of potential opportunities for sales and revenue generation



  




**Who you are** 
* To be successful in this role, you must be a true self-starter who is prepared to roll your sleeves up and get involved
* Strong ownership mentality and willingness to see opportunities through to completion
* At least 3-5 years experience in complex B2B sales and/or business development, preferably payments for online gambling
* Preferably you have a large network in the online gambling and/or payments industry
* A solution-driven problem solver with a creative mindset
* A strong team player with the ability to manage internal and external stakeholders with the highest degree of professionalism, firmness, integrity
* The ability to discuss and negotiate with customers at CXO-level
* Superb verbal and written communication skills in English and preferably another European language
* Your track record of success in sales speaks for itself!






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.

title: Compensation Benefits Specialist
description:
**About us** 




 Headquartered in Sweden, Envirotainer is a small but global company that built an entire industry some 35+ years ago. We now bring more than 2,000,000 doses per day of much-needed medicines to patients across the world and our ambition is to double that over the next couple of years.
 



  





 We are on an exciting growth journey. Currently, we are around 450 dedicated specialists in 16 countries that develop, manufacture and offer leasing options of innovative container solutions for pharmaceutical products that require a controlled environment. We do this jointly together with our partners with the belief that it takes an Eco-system to safely deliver medicines to the people that depend upon them. In time, to the right place and in the right condition. There is no room for error.
 



  





 As we continue to grow our business, we are now looking for a
 **Compensation & Benefits Specialist** 
 to join our global HR-team based in Sweden. This is a new, and important, role in our organization as it essentially is about ensuring attractiveness and competitiveness of the global employment offer to facilitate our continued growth.
 



  





**About the role** 




 In close dialogue with our business leaders, you will drive the development of our Compensation & Benefits agenda to the next level in line with our business strategy. In this role you will be responsible for building and maintaining the structure for compensation and benefits elements, overseeing local as well as global elements, and continuously improve employment offer to ensure attractiveness in the local market.
 



  





 You will drive the development of policies and guidelines for the compensation and benefits field across our business and as we continue our digitalization journey, you will help us towards digitalized compensation and benefits master data and salary review process.
 



  





 In addition, you will be responsible for:
 



  





 - Our company-wide career framework including position evaluation framework – with link to benefits elements.
 



 - Driving the development of our long-term incentive program both design and implementation
 



 - Streamlining and securing processes globally, including adjacent processes such as time and attendance.
 



 - Data analytics in relations to C&B field
 



  





**About you** 




 If you enjoy driving development in a fast-paced environment in a role where you can truly make an impact, this one is for you. You bring several years of experience within compensation and benefits from an international and fast-paced environment where you have worked across multiple countries.
 



  





 You have strong analytical skills and ability to prioritize tasks and independently manage multiple competing priorities. As a person you are well-organized, energetic and with strong attention to detail. You have strong Excel and Power Point skills as well as a bachelor’s degree or higher in a related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
 



  





**More about us** 




 Envirotainer is the global market leader in secure cold chain solutions for air transport of pharmaceuticals. Our combined experience allows us to provide advice and help pharmaceutical companies, and their logistics partners, to deliver pharmaceuticals in need of temperature-control all over the world. The main objective is the safe delivery of pharmaceuticals by maintaining the integrity and quality of their products throughout the cold chain.
 



  





**Intenco** 




 In this recruitment we work with
 **Intenco (www.intenco.se).** 
 We interview continuously but please send us your application by August 26. For questions, please contact
 **anette.lidman@intenco.se or sandra.waldnert@intenco.se** 
 .
 



 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Butiksmedarbetare, team färsk, Willys Täby Arninge
description:
*Vi är alla olika. Och det är härligt! Vi anställer inte människor efter en viss mall utan efter vem du är. För oss är driv och personlighet viktigare än erfarenhet och bakgrund. Det går bra för oss, och vi växer så det knakar. Nu söker vi fler glada medarbetare med rätt inställning och vilja att utvecklas!*
**Om jobbet**
**Tjänsten avser:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning på 8 timmar i veckan, provanställning tillämpas
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 2024-09-09 eller enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Arbetstider:** 
 Du kommer att variera mellan att arbeta tidig morgon, dagtid, kvällar och helger
   

  

**Krav:** 
 Gymnasial utbildning, goda kunskaper i svenska (tal och skrift). Vi välkomnar sökande i alla åldrar, men med anledning av Arbetsmiljölagen ska du ha fyllt 18 år
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill bli en del av vårt härliga gäng på Willys Täby Arninge! Tjänsten innebär kort och gott att du, tillsammans med dina kollegor, bidrar till att erbjuda våra kunder bra och hållbar mat till riktigt bra priser. Du är en viktig del av butiksteamet som ser till att ge våra kunder den bästa butiksupplevelsen. Här kommer lite mer om tjänsten:
   

  

* Tillsammans med dina kollegor sköter du den omväxlande dagliga driften på färskvaruavdelningen. Du kan räkna med att få många steg på stegräknaren!
* Du ser till att våra kylar och hyllor är välfyllda och ser fina ut.
* Du ser till att det är rent och snyggt i butiken.
* Du tar aktivt del i beställningar och säljplanering och bidrar till att butiken når sina försäljnings- och lönsamhetsmål.
* Du hjälper våra kunder till rätta och möter dem med kunskap, fingertoppskänsla och ett stort leende.
* Du hjälper våra kunder i kassan eller något av våra andra utcheckningsalternativ.


**Om oss**
 Det är inte alla som passar att jobba hos oss. Men många tycker att det är kul! För oss är rätt inställning och vilja att utvecklas viktigare än erfarenhet och utbildning. Hos oss får du jobba ihop med ett helt team av sköna personligheter med olika bakgrunder, kunskaper och perspektiv.
   

  

 Lite mer om oss kommer här:
   

  

* Vi är ansluta till Handelsanställdas kollektivavtal där schyssta villkor som pension, försäkringar och bra OB-ersättning ingår.
* Du får friskvårdsbidrag, personalrabatt och personalerbjudanden efter en tids anställning.
* Hållbarhet är viktigt för oss och vi arbetar till exempel alltid med att minska matsvinn i och utanför våra butiker.
* Vi ger dig bra möjligheter att växa genom olika ansvarsområden och utbildningar. Många som börjat sin resa som butiksmedarbetare på Willys är idag teamchefer, butikschefer eller har en specialistroll på vårt kontor.
* Du får erfarenheter – om t ex försäljning, service och om att driva butik – som du kommer att ha nytta av oavsett vad du väljer att göra längre fram.
* Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss här.


**Om dig**
 Du gillar mat, människor och försäljning lika mycket som vi! För oss spelar det ingen roll om du är vegan eller köttfantast, äter tacos en fredag eller en tisdag. Det fina med dig är att du är du. Och det är just det vi letar efter.
   

  

* Du vill lära dig nya saker och utvecklas.
* Du har positiv inställning och vill ha roligt på jobbet.
* Du ser när något behöver göras, kavlar upp ärmarna och får det gjort.
* Du har lätt för att samarbeta med andra – hos oss jobbar vi tillsammans som ett lag!
* Du har god IT- och datorvana, är noggrann och har inga problem att navigera i olika system.
* Det är en fördel om du har jobbat i butik eller med service, men det är inte ett krav.
* Du pratar, skriver och förstår svenska. Många av våra kunder talar fler språk än det, så om du gör detsamma är det toppen!


 Om du vill veta mer om vad tjänsten innebär, kontakta Diana Björkman, diana.bjorkman@willys.se. Vi ser gärna att du vid intresse skickar din ansökan så snart som möjligt, då tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag den 2024-09-03. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via våra jobbsidor.
   

  

*För att ta reda på om just du är den vi söker så innehåller vår rekryteringsprocess både tester och intervjuer.*
*Vi gör även bakgrundskontroll vid samtliga rekryteringar. Läs mer:* 
 Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood
   

  

 Observera att vi inte under denna process kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id, uppge något lösenord eller scanna någon QR-kod. Vid frågor kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se.

title: Underwriting Service Coordinator - Property
description:
**Job Description**
 Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly.
   

  

 The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
   

  

 In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.
   

  

**Role Purpose**
 Are you looking for a customer centric role in the world of financial services? Do you excel in taking ownership, thinking outside of the box and putting the customer at the heart of what you do? Then this role could be the opportunity for you.
   

  

 As an Underwriting Service Coordinator, you will get to work within an international and dynamic environment within our Commercial Lines division in EMEA. You will proactively support underwriting teams by delivering high quality customer service, taking ownership of operational functions and service aspects, coordinating with a variety of different functions and teams, allowing underwriters to focus on production and underwriting
   

  

 The Underwriting Service Coordinator is responsible for supporting the end-to-end lifecycle of producing and issuing an insurance policy for our customers, along with any associated problem solving. For some parts you will be working with underwriters to create accurate and practical instructions for supporting teams to process information, for others you will be performing the processing yourself. This could include new business customers just joining us, renewal customers staying with us for another year, or it could be changes customers would like to make during the term of their insurance. All are to be approached and performed with the customer at the heart; wanting to ensure your work is correct when the customer needs it and to the agreed Chubb service standards.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage a portfolio of Domestic and Multinational accounts performing account administration and Multinational program implementation tasks. In conjunction to supporting our underwriters by providing them with underwriting, regulatory, and compliance information and or advice on program structures as well as preparing instructions for the processing and issuance of new business, renewals and endorsements, invoices, and documentation. All within the required time frames, and to the required quality standard applying right first-time principle
* Be a focal point for internal colleagues, working closely with Segment leaders, Line Managers, Underwriters, and our Service centres to deliver agreed client service standards, troubleshoot and solve any issues affecting the customer.
* Be a focal point for Broker administration queries with regards to local market practice, our market and service offering as well as regulatory / tax queries. In addition to supporting the timely resolution of credit control queries
* Assist where required with ongoing Projects that are identified throughout a given year for improvement to Line or Operations, being an expert on the process, a tester or helping others understand where opportunities for improvement in the process may be.
* Pro-actively hunt for opportunities of improving the customers’ experience and perform ad hoc associated work requests for your role


**Qualifications**
**Experience :**
* Experience of servicing multinational insurance programmes or servicing master policies (understanding of premium allocation, how policy is issued and booked) or
* Working experience of at least 2 lines of business in insurance
* Experience on client facing roles in the insurance industry, including client meeting, presentations
* Practice of underwriting process and reinsurance process
* Proficient in MS office tools


**Qualifications**
* Insurance Certification
* University Degree


**Languages**
* Local Language
* Fluent English
* A foreign language would be an advantage.

title: Account Manager / Affärsutvecklare
description:
**Account Manager / Affärsutvecklare till Kuusakoski Recycling** 




**Om rollen** 




 Som Account Manager/Affärsutvecklare på Kuusakoskis ITAD-avdelning kommer du att erbjuda kunder en helhetslösning inom datasäkert återbruk av IT-produkter såsom exempelvis datorer, mobiltelefoner och nätverksutrustning.
 



 Ditt uppdrag blir att hitta nya samarbeten med kommuner, IT-återförsäljare och företag men även att förvalta befintliga relationer och att vara med och sätta upp strategier och utveckla avdelningen framåt. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår både nykundsbearbetning och affärsutveckling, allt för att affärsområdet ska växa och erbjuda fler och bättre tjänster.
 



 Teamet på avdelningen består idag av 6 kollegor fördelat på kontor och produktion och i denna roll kommer du att jobba nära Head of ITAD. Då detta är ett relativt nytt affärsområde på Kuusakoski så kommer du ha stora möjligheter att vara med och påverka både din egen roll och även avdelningen, och utvecklingsmöjligheterna framåt är mycket stora.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du är en engagerad och självgående person som har lätt för att skapa relationer och som brinner för att göra affärer och ta fram lösningar som passar dina kunder. Du är kreativ och vill vara med och påverka hur framtidens erbjudanden inom IT-återbruk ska se ut. Du är målinriktad och prestigelös och trivs med att jobba i en föränderlig miljö. Vi tror också att du har ett genuint intresse för hållbarhetsfrågor och cirkulär ekonomi.
 



 Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift är ett krav, liksom körkort. I rollen ingår förmånsbil. Du har även tidigare erfarenhet av företagsförsäljning och vana av att vara en uppskattad ambassadör för det företag du representerar.
 



 Har du erfarenhet av ITAD-branschen är det starkt meriterande men inget krav.
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Kuusakoski ITAD är ett växande affärsområde med fokus på tjänsterna Datasäkert återbruk, Datadestruktion och Expressåtervinning. Kontoret och dess produktionsavdelning ligger i Länna, Skogås men det finns även möjlighet att jobba till viss del remote eller från vårt kontor i Spånga.
 



 Här kommer du till ett välmående familjeföretag grundat 1914 som erbjuder korta beslutsvägar, goda villkor, kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag mm.
 



 Kuusakoski finns i fem länder och i Sverige har vi ca 200 anställda och anläggningar över hela landet.
 



  





  





*Rekryteringen sköts av Women Ahead – en rekryteringsbyrå med fokus på jämställdhet, mångfald och inkludering. För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Jessica Enqvist på jessica@womenahead.se eller 0703- 80 78 88*

title: Data Scientist, Solna
description:
We seek to strengthen our position and increase the speed of the implementation of data science, machine learning and AI solutions in PostNord. We are looking for three Data Scientists who will play an important role in helping PostNord to become an AI and data driven business. We offer you a cutting-edge Analytics environment, very competent colleagues as well as good benefits and a really cool office. Apply now to the Data Scientist role!
   

  

**Join us**
 The Technology Acceleration area with Group IT is responsible for establishing the future IT landscape that will be the foundation for PostNord' s continued AI and data driven journey. PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a Data Scientist at PostNord you will engage in projects, combining technical expertise within areas such data collection and exploration, model development and model deployment and operation. As a Data Scientist, you will are able to independently develop and deploy models, both statistical and machine learning. We are looking for data scientists for our existing ML team which delivers production volume forecast to PostNords business and we are also looking for data scientists to our newly formed AI- and Concept development teams. It is our goal to deploy efficient and accurate models and keep the models up to date through a set of well-defined MLOps practices.
   

  

**Job Duties**
* Work in an agile team to deliver the best possible data solutions for PostNord.
* Identify, prepare, explore and analyze data from various data sets.
* Understand the business requirements and develop ML solutions accordingly.
* Ensure best practices, such as quality and security, are followed in all stages of the product development life cycle.
* Identify, collect and analyze data and train new ML models.
* Collaborate within team boundaries aiming to share knowledge and best practices.
* Keeps up to date with data science trends in and outside of PostNord.
* Sound knowledge of statistics and machine learning.
* take ownership of the teams solutions whether new or old and help establish best in class MLOps .


**We are looking for you who have**
* A bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
* At least 3-5 years of work experience
* Proficiency in Python and at least one of the following frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
* Sound knowledge of statistics
* Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts and techniques, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
* Experience in applying machine learning methods to real-world data sets and problems, preferably in the domain of production forecasting or time series analysis.
* Understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
* Experience in working with time series data and using frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras for building and training neural network models for forecasting or anomaly detection.


**Your profile as an Data Scientist**
 You have worked with statistical analysis and Machine Learning solutions in an agile team before. You like to work hands on, and to work directly with our business stakeholders. You have an academic background and as a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state-of-the-art pace in the domain that you work in.
   

  

**Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)**
* Experience in developing and deploying end-to-end machine learning pipelines in cloud-based environments (Azure preferred) using tools such as MLflow, Azure ML Studio and Azure DevOps.
* Experience in working with cloud platforms (Azure preferred) and using their services for data storage, processing, and analysis.
* Data visualisation experience; preferably in Power BI
* Prior experience implementing generative AI/LLM’s or ML.
* Experience in applying DevOps principles and practices to machine learning projects, such as version control, testing, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
* Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.


**System requirements:**
* Azure ML Studio, Azure DevOps, Azure Open AI (or similar AWS/GCP technologies)
* Python, Pandas
* SQL
* Power BI


**Language requirement:**
 Fluent English in speech and writing. Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.
   

  

**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer you a flexible hybrid workplace with a prestige-free environment where we as a team help each other to reach our goals. We encourage self-sufficient leadership for development and career opportunities. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Work in a Nordic/International and flexible environment.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions
* Wellness allowance & access to office gym and swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Christian Mejlvang, Christian.mejlvang@postnord.com
   

  

 Click here for union contacts

title: Senior Java Software Engineer
description:
**Who we are** 




 Codepole is a fast-growing venture enabler & consulting company that focuses on the tech industry. We are experts in finance, product development, and app development with solid experience from tech companies (Google, Zalando, Kindred) and the financial industry (Deutsche Bank, Credit Suisse, EY, Kreditech, Advanon). Apart from building our own ventures, we help companies and startups across Europe to excel in their respective fields.
 



  





**How we work** 




 We believe that it is key for our team members to grow their skill set and that this is done by experiencing challenging technical projects and by learning from each other. The work is varied between time-based projects for clients, team augmentation for clients, and our own ventures and products. This allows our team members to continuously develop as they get to experience different technologies, problems, and solutions. Our team members share their knowledge with each other on a daily basis, so we ensure that we learn as much as possible.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Work on interesting and challenging projects for our clients across Europe, ranging from a couple of months to up to a year. As a Java Developer, your tasks will include design, development, and delivery of backend components and services to accelerate data transformation and deliver value to the end-user faster.
* When not on a project for a client, take part in exciting internal projects for Codepole’s own ventures, such as a business loan broker operating on the Swedish market, an insurance broker, or a mortgage broker. Internal projects are tailored to the areas you would like to develop within and what brings value to the ventures. We value your ideas for the next ventures!
* Contribute to the development of CodePole in whatever way you can do it the best, be it sharing your knowledge, organizing professional speakers to run workshops for the team, taking part in our client calls, improving on our recruitment process, or planning our next team event.



  





**Who you are** 



* You are experienced with developing Java based applications (ideally Java 11+, Spring, Hibernate).
* Experience working with some of the following: AWS/GCP/Azure, NoSQL/Mongo, microservices, Cassandra, Kafka, Elasticsearch, Docker will be beneficial.
* You have good communication skills, being able to cooperate both with the tech and business teams.
* You are a driven person striving to improve things and enjoy getting things done.
* You have professional proficiency in English (fluency in Swedish is a big plus).
* You are used to working in an agile team and care about personal and team development.
* You are based in Sweden.



  





**What we offer** 



* Challenging and interesting assignments, internally and at our clients across the world.
* An environment that allows, encourages, and supports you in your professional development.
* Competitive salary.
* Hybrid working model with flexible working hours
* A lot of office fun :)

title: License Operations Specialist Nordics and East
description:
**About The Job**
**Join our team as License Operation Specialist Nordics and East**
**Why Choose TD SYNNEX:**
 As a
 **Fortune 500 global corporation** 
 , operating in over 100 countries, TD SYNNEX values its diverse workforce of 22,000 employees. As the biggest IT distributor in the world, our mission is to provide top-notch technology solutions, empowering businesses, and individuals to navigate the digital world safely and efficiently.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Finland, Denmark or Sweden – depending on where you live.
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent full time
   

  

**Start** 
 : 1st of September latest or in August 2024
   

  

**About the role:**
 For this position we aim to find you who wants to work within the IT-spectrum and have a close contact to our client and partners. At TD SYNNEX we are keen to teach you the skills you need to know to be successful in this role. As
 **License Operation Specialist Nordics and East** 
 role you will, among other things, handle incoming order flows at the company. In this position you will grow within the role and you will keep sharing insights and experiences and skills with your colleagues.
   

  

**Main tasks:**
* Placing orders and making quotes to our partners regarding various vendors like VMware, Veeam, Red Hat, Google, Adobe and Microsoft
* Handling return requests
* Work continually with e-mail communications cross our Nordic and East countries in Europe
* Backlog management
* Answering incoming phone calls from partners
* License management; handling anniversary processes and renewals for license agreements
* Other administrative tasks, also completing, changing and monitor order flow


**About You:**
 To be successful in the role as License Operation Specialist Nordics and East
   

  

* You have a positive mindset of solving different problems
* You are self-motivated and take own initiatives independently and as part of a team
* You like administration, have an accurate working method and have a strong sense of service
* You need good computer skills and good knowledge of Office-package is also meritorious
* It is meritorious if you have worked with SAP or other business systems before, but it’s not a demand since we are keen to teach you
* Fluent spoken and written skills in local language: Finnish, Swedish or Danish and good spoken and written English skills are requirement for this role


 We can offer the candidate with the right qualifications and attitude, a job in an International market-leading company. Does it sound exciting with a company that operates globally, in an ambitious market and has committed and welcoming co-workers? Then maybe TD SYNNEX would be an attractive workplace for you! For the right person, there are also good opportunities to keep developing within TD SYNNEX.
   

  

**What’s In It For You?**
* Great team and co-workers. TD SYNNEX is Great Place to work certified company in the Nordics
* Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


**Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**
 At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!
   

  

**What’s In It For You?**
* Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
* Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
* Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


**Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**
 At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

title: Global Account Manager Nordics
description:
**🚀 Role: Global Account Manager Nordics** 




**📅 Start Date: October 2024** 




**📍 Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**💰 Salary: Competitive with benefits** 




  





*Sick of needing five signatures to get anything done?* 




 When you join us, you’ll enjoy a flat structure where you have direct access to our Sales Director, Jérôme.
 



 You'll join a "get it done" culture where you'll be encouraged to challenge the status quo; it's how we evolve and improve!
 



  





**What will you do?** 




 When you join us as Global Account Manager Nordics, you will start working with a number of our Nordics and international customers. You are their first point of contact, you answer their queries, and you keep them satisfied and engaged with our products and services. You will also actively seek new opportunities to grow your accounts’ revenue.
 



  





**Main objectives** 



* Managing a portfolio of accounts to achieve long-term success
* Communicating with customers in order to understand their needs and to explain our product value
* Ensuring prompt and accurate answers to client’s queries
* Developing additional business with existing customers by keeping them informed on our new product features and by engaging with them to use our solution on a larger geographical scope
* Achieving your personal target and contribute to the Sales team’s target.



  





**Tasks & key responsibilities** 




  




* You identify stakeholders and contact persons while keeping our CRM up to date
* You stay in touch with your assigned customers and grow long-lasting relationships
* You expand the commercial relationship within your assigned customer portfolio by identifying sales opportunities and following-up until sales order (renewals and up-sells)
* You deliver throughout the sales cycle, this includes preparing presentations, delivering demos and creating offers
* You document and track opportunity progress in our CRM (we use Hubspot)
* You validate and process change requests
* You assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations if needed
* You participate in departmental improvement initiatives



  





**About You:** 



* **🎓 Experience** 
 : +5 years of successful track record as Account Executive/Manager within a B2B SaaS environment and experience working with enterprise customers
* experience in private RFPs and public Swedish RFPs is a must
* **🛠️ Tools Proficiency** 
 : we use Hubspot and Linkedin Sales Navigator, any knowledge of Hubspot would be awesome
* **💼 Commercial Acumen:** 
 entrepreneurial and commercial spirit, and thrive in a hands-on environment
* you love to go the extra mile to delight your customers and deliver results
* your relationship skills are second to none, you make it your business to become a trusted advisor to your customers
* **🤝** 
**Team work** 
 : You work well with others and actively contribute to team meetings/objectives/events, we want to hear your voice!
* **🌍 Language Skills** 
 : native Swedish and fluent in English, knowledge of other languages would be great



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 At Mobilexpense, you’ll be part of a cutting-edge B2B SaaS scale-up, driving impactful change within a collaborative, flat-structured environment. Our CEO, Thibaud, is always accessible, and our approach is straightforward and efficient—focused on delivering real value without unnecessary complexity. 💼
 



  





**Our mission is clear:** 
 to simplify and enhance the lives of employees, accountants, and HR managers. We've helped over 2000 companies streamline their expense management processes, making a real difference in their operations. 🌟
 



  





 We’re proud of our diverse and inclusive culture, with 24 nationalities represented and a workforce that is 47% female. Our presence spans across Europe, with offices in Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany, Sweden, Romania, and Portugal. 🌍
 



  





 Join us, and you’ll not only contribute to our ongoing success but also drive the growth and development of our talented team. Your expertise will be valued, and you’ll have the opportunity to catalyze meaningful change. 💥
 



  





**Welcome to Mobilexpense—where your skills drive progress and innovation.** 
 🚀

title: NetSuite Swedish Sales Representative - Emerging
description:

 Oracle NetSuite offers automated financial processes to improve finance operations efficiency and productivity. Oracle NetSuite has a number of modules including: Finance, Inventory Management, Supply Chain Management, Manufacturing, CRM, Procurement, HR Management, E-Commerce and Project Management!
   

  

**Why work at Oracle**
* Join a global workplace where you can make an impact.
* We offer competitive salaries and exciting benefits – along with flexible working to suit your lifestyle.
* Get access to development opportunities that can advance your career, an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health, and benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning.
* Be yourself in an inclusive culture where employee resource groups champion our diverse communities.


*https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/*
**What You’ll Do**
 As a new business Sales Representative, you will identify and qualify opportunities for new business sales. You will sell NetSuite’s business applications within a specific vertical team in the Emerging markets. You will present the customer with solutions through strategic selling, effective negotiation, and management of the client relationship. This will include:
   

  

* Build and maintain a strong pipeline of opportunities, which enables you to drive consistent delivery of monthly ARR
* Utilise outbound sales techniques to identify, qualify and close new opportunities
* Understand NetSuite’s product offerings and competitive advantage in order to develop tailored solution proposals
* Defining and executing considered win strategies, and managing the entire sales process
* Collaborate with team members in Business Development, Pre Sales, Marketing, Competitive Intelligence, and the Bid Team

**Responsibilities**
*At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences—we celebrate them. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work.  In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.
   

  

 Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability.  At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities.  That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.

 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
